title: (x) MS Windows font, similar to Textile - Lucida Big Casual {Mike F}
content:
I'm looking for a font similar to the one in this image. I hope the attachment shows up(!)  
[also see the logo "Sunbelt" at: http://www.sunbeltsnacks.com/]; if not, I think that it is **Textile** , an Apple font. Can anyone suggest a similar font in a Windows format? The closest I've found so far is called  
**Rostrum** ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/rostrum/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104171605/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/rostrum/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/rostrum/") ). Another somewhat similar one is  
**Challenge Bold** ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/challenge-bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104171605/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/challenge-bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/challenge-bold/") ). Neither is as close as I'd like.

I see this font used very often on food packaging - cereals, etc - and that's the look I'm after.

Any suggestions?

Thanks so much,  
- Paul
author: hommealone

comments.content:
\> I see this font used very often on food packaging - cereals, etc

Sample? Maybe custom?

**FF Tartine Script TF Black** is terrific, and a great suggestion; thanks!

It might well work for me. It's perhaps a bit more flourishy (sorry, I'm not well versed in typography vocabulary) than would be ideal ( **Textile** is quite a bit plainer), so any other suggestions would also be appreciated!

Thanks again,  
- Paul

I was going to recommend [Lucida Casual Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104171605/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/lucida-cas-d/), which has a great deal in common with Textile. No coincidence, as both were created by by Kris Holmes. It would have required some artificial bolding.

Never mind that, though. I just happened across the recently released [Lucida Big Casual T Demi Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104171605/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/lucida-big-casual/) - which is a veritable match for Textile.

Maybe you want to give a chance to some others packaging oriented type designs like [Chocolate](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104171605/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts-chocolate.htm) or [Felipe](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104171605/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts-felipe.htm) :)

Yes, **Lucida Big Casual T Demi Italic** is indeed a near-exact match for textile, which is just what I asked for - Thanks so much!

But now that you folks have recommended these other great choices, I've got a difficult decision to make. Which is great! Thanks!

[Note to _alepaul_ and _Bald Condensed_: you guys are mind readers; great suggestions!]

- Paul

Paul  
the packaging labe design world is oversaturated of Textile because it was a system font. So, if you want to generate a new brand package ID I suggest a new option or maybe a custom work. Best
